summary: This bill, the Mental and Physical Health Care Comorbidities Act of 2025, establishes a demonstration program under Medicare to promote collaborative treatment for individuals with mental and physical health comorbidities. The program aims to identify and disseminate best practices, assist in payment reforms, and support eligible hospitals in providing innovative care, particularly in vulnerable communities. It focuses on addressing social determinants of health and improving patient outcomes through various interventions, including care coordination, mental health services integration, and targeted support services. The program's activities will be evaluated and reported to Congress.
